podcasts.name: Brain Sparks
podcasts.description: This podcast is hosted by usability and UI design expert, Jared Spool. It offers tona of value with many industry leaders sharing insights on usability, UX design, and UI design.

podcasts.name: The Dirt Show
podcasts.description: The Dirt Show is a podcast hosted by the team behind the UX design agency, Fresh Tilled Soil. One cool thing about this podcast is some topics follow a mini-series format, with multiple episodes and different guests talking about the same topic. For example, they have a mini-series on topics such as "designing your career" and "designing the future".

podcasts.name: The UX Intern
podcasts.description: A monthly podcast interviewing seasoned User Experience Designers from the perspective of a UX Intern.

podcasts.name: UX Podcast
podcasts.description: UX Podcast is for people passionate about balancing business, technology and users within the realm of digital media. Moving the conversation beyond the traditional realm of User Experience.

podcasts.name: UX and Growth
podcasts.description: Every Monday, HubSpot Design, UX, & Growth geeks Matt Rheault, Austin Knight, and Geoff Daigle sit down for a couple of beers while discussing User Experience and Growth tactics.

podcasts.name: UX Pod
podcasts.description: Gerry Gaffney set up the User Experience podcast in 2006, with a view to providing a platform for discussing topics of interest to practitioners or others with an interest in UX.

podcasts.name: UX Mastery
podcasts.description: UX Mastery is a website that hosts a lot of useful articles and content related to user experience design. The site also has an infrequently updated podcast.

podcasts.name: UX Discovery Session
podcasts.description: A discovery session is an opportunity to learn about a relevant topic, generate ideas that expand a new technique or practice, or brainstorm concepts and ideas for the next new thing.

podcasts.name: Incremental UX
podcasts.description: Hosted by Vinay Raghu. This podcast learns from people in the industry. Hour long episodes dive deep into specific topics with industry experts

podcasts.name: UX Defenders
podcasts.description: This podcast is aimed at highlighting those leading the way in their craft by diving deeper into who they are, and what makes them tick/successful, in order to inspire and equip those aspiring to do the same.

podcasts.name: Binpress Podcast
podcasts.description: A podcast about making and selling digital products. Marketing, distribution and other tips around helping you build and sell digital products

podcasts.name: Seanwes Podcast
podcasts.description: Join entrepreneurs Sean McCabe and Ben Toalson as they let you inside their discussions on the many facets of making a living online. You'll come away from every episode with something of value that you can apply to your business. Tangible insights on creativity and business every single Wednesday and Friday.

podcasts.name: Let's Make Mistakes
podcasts.description: Award-winning designer Mike Montiero of Mule Design Studios talks shop with an assorted collection of co-hosts about standard design concepts, from ideation to implementation, and how to leverage every ounce of creativity throughout the process.

podcasts.name: Young Guns Show
podcasts.description: The Young Guns Show aims to feature and inspire the young guns in the web industry — the guys and gals that aren't waiting for "someday" to do amazing things.

podcasts.name: The Web Ahead
podcasts.description: Conversations with world experts on changing technologies and future of the web. The Web Ahead is your shortcut to keeping up. Hosted by Jen Simmons.

podcasts.name: Typeradio
podcasts.description: Typeradio is a regular podcast station that covers all things type, including fonts, typography and trends.

podcasts.name: BizCraft
podcasts.description: The bi-weekly podcast. hosted by Carl Smith of nGen Works and Gene Crawford of UnmatchedStyle. The primary topic is the business side of digital design.

podcasts.name: Iterate Podcast
podcasts.description: Iterate is a fortnightly podcast, focusing on mobile and app design for all iOS, Mac, Android and other platforms.

podcasts.name: ShopTalk
podcasts.description: ShopTalk is a podcast about front end web design, development and UX. Each week Chris Coyier and Dave Rupert are joined by a special guest to talk shop and answer listener submitted questions.

podcasts.name: Data Stories
podcasts.description: Enrico Bertini and Moritz Stefaner discuss the latest developments in data analytics, visualization and related topics.

podcasts.name: The Boagworld Web Show
podcasts.description: Boagworld is a podcast about digital for all those involved in designing, developing or running a website on a daily basis. It offers practical advice, news, tools, review and interviews with leading figures in the web design community. Covering everything from usability and design to marketing and strategy, this show has something for everything. This award winning podcast is the longest running web design podcast with over 380 episodes.

podcasts.name: The Big Web Show
podcasts.description: The award winning Big Web Show features special guests and topics like web publishing, art direction, content strategy, typography, web technology, and more. It's everything web that matters.

podcasts.name: A Responsive Web Design Podcast
podcasts.description: A podcast from Karen McGrane and Ethan Marcotte, who interview people who make responsive designs happen.

podcasts.name: The Deeply Graphic Designcast
podcasts.description: The Deeply Graphic DesignCast is a podcast aimed at graphic and web designers with a simple philosophy: to talk about all the things that they don’t teach in design school. Every episode tackles a new design related topic, and the hosts engage in a roundtable discussion on the topic at hand, offering the benefit of their experience, “tips from the trenches,” and above all, lively conversation that people actually look forward to listening to. In addition to the topic of the day, the gang gets the audience involved by answering a listener-submitted question every single episode.

podcasts.name: The Gently Mad
podcasts.description: The Gently Mad is a show about life, business & entrepreneurship without the bullshit. New episodes every Monday, Wednesday and Friday.

podcasts.name: Adventures In Design
podcasts.description: Graphic design gossip and artistic growing pains through the eyes of two handsome DIY poster designers and their friends.

podcasts.name: Revision Path
podcasts.description: A weekly showcase of the world's Black graphic designers, web designers, and web developers.

podcasts.name: Design Review
podcasts.description: A weekly podcast about products from a unique designer perspective! Your hosts are Chris Liu and Jonathan Shariat. Each week, we will go through a product and talk about the experience and hopefully it will be interesting and informative, along with entertaining! So join us here every week!

podcasts.name: Working Out
podcasts.description: Join Ashley Baxter and Paddy Donnelly on a journey to figure out how to create a business doing what you love. Is it possible to make a living from your hobby? On Working out, Ashley & Paddy discuss their own personal journeys in creating their passion-based business. This is about the expedition, the here and now, the daily challenges and achievements towards getting paid for your passion.

podcasts.name: Resourceful Designer
podcasts.description: Wouldn't it be nice if you could spend more time designing and less time worrying about your design business? Resourceful Designer offers tips, tricks and resources to help streamline your graphic design and web design business so you can get back to what you do best… Designing! Let me know what topics you would like me to cover by emailing feedback@resourcefuldesigner.com

podcasts.name: 99% Invisible
podcasts.description: 99% Invisible (99 Percent Invisible) is a weekly exploration of the process and power of design and architecture. From award winning producer Roman Mars, KALW in San Francisco, and Radiotopia from PRX.

podcasts.name: The Start
podcasts.description: The Start is a podcast focused on creative individuals and their growth in the industry, from the very beginning.

podcasts.name: The Fizzle Show
podcasts.description: The Fizzle Show is a podcast for creative entrepreneurs and honest business builders who want to earn a living doing something they care about.

podcasts.name: Happy Monday
podcasts.description: A new, short-burst, industry podcast available every Monday from 7am GMT.

podcasts.name: Pencil vs Pixel
podcasts.description: Pencil vs Pixel is where creation meets creators. A podcast and resource for the originators, the tinkerers, the makers of the world to share the process, the principle and the payoff in doing what we do. It’s the juncture of idea and result, where builders and doers of things both analog and digital discuss the way we make things, experience challenges and wins.

podcasts.name: PageBreak Podcast
podcasts.description: Pagebreak is an audio podcast hosted by Liz Andrade and Niki Brown. Discussions pertain to Freelance, Design, Development, Marketing and other such things.

podcasts.name: Non Breaking Space Show
podcasts.description: Seeking out the best, brightest, and smartest creative people on digital art, design, and development. From workflows to life hacks, we examine why they do what they do and how they did it. Hosted by Chris Enns, Christopher Schmitt and Sam Kapila.

podcasts.name: Debug
podcasts.description: Debug is a conversational interview show about developing software and services, primarily for iPhone, iPad, Mac, and gaming.

podcasts.name: This Developer's Life
podcasts.description: A podcast about developers and their lives.

podcasts.name: Back to Work
podcasts.description: Back to Work is an award winning talk show with Merlin Mann and Dan Benjamin discussing productivity, communication, work, barriers, constraints, tools, and more.

podcasts.name: The New Disruptors
podcasts.description: The New Disruptors tells stories that provide practical inspiration about the way that creative people and producers connect with audiences to perform, cajole, convince, sell, and interact using new methods. Hosted by Glenn Fleishman, a regular contributor to The Economist and the editor and publisher of The Magazine. Produced by Aperiodical LLC.

podcasts.name: Design Matters
podcasts.description: Design Matters with Debbie Millman is a thought-provoking internet podcast, which profiles industry-leading graphic designers, change agents, artists, writers and educators.

podcasts.name: The Balance
podcasts.description: Discussing the balance between creativity & everything that fuels it

podcasts.name: CodePen Radio
podcasts.description: Chris Coyier, Alex Vazquez, and Tim Sabat, the co-founders of CodePen talk about the ins and outs of running a web software business.

podcasts.name: Developer Tea
podcasts.description: Developer Tea is a podcast for web and software developers hosted by a developer that you can listen to in less than 10 minutes. The show will cover a wide variety of topics related to the career of being a developer.

podcasts.name: Late Nights with Trav and Los
podcasts.description: Join Travis and Carlos for a late night discussion about being a healthy and productive professional in todays creative economy. Casual, fun, educational (maybe).

podcasts.name: The Rocketship Podcast
podcasts.description: Get actionable advice and incredible insights from the business leaders of today and tomorrow. From growth-hacking to sales, customer service to company culture, Rocketship.fm delivers it all every Tuesday and Thursday each week.

podcasts.name: Startup Podcast
podcasts.description: A series about what it's really like to start a business.

podcasts.name: Viewsources Podcat
podcasts.description: Viewsources Podcast is another podcast about front-end development and web design. They discuss the important posts and links circulating among our peers and tackle issues that we find ourselves working through day in and day out. Viewsources is hosted by Tim Evko, Charles Peters & Brad Cerasani.

podcasts.name: Talking Code
podcasts.description: The Talking Code podcast contains short expert interviews that help you decode what developers are saying. We help non-technical founders, designers, project managers, or anyone who needs a 30,000 foot view of how to run a successful software company.

podcasts.name: Nice To Meet You
podcasts.description: Nice To Meet You is a personal conversation based podcasts with makers, creators and no bullshitters

podcasts.name: Immutable
podcasts.description: A short, weekly show about design and development hosted by Sam Soffes & Bryn Jackson.

podcasts.name: Does Not Compute
podcasts.description: A weekly chat about the lives and workflows of modern web developers, hosted by Sean Washington & Paul Straw.

podcasts.name: Design Details
podcasts.description: A show about the people who design our favorite products. Hosted by Bryn Jackson and Brian Lovin.

podcasts.name: Vicarious
podcasts.description: Pop culture through the lens of design and vice versa.

podcasts.name: Beyond This Point
podcasts.description: Beyond This Point is a series of conversations engaging the creative thinkers who inspire us. Each episode, Gabriel Stromberg, Creative Director of Civilization, sits down with artists, business owners, designers, and leaders of all types to put a spotlight on different ways of seeing, thinking, and making.

podcasts.name: Layout
podcasts.description: Layout is a weekly podcast about design, technology, programming and everything else.

podcasts.name: Dorm Room Tycoon
podcasts.description: Interviews that cut to the chase and extract wisdom. Learning from the most influential innovators. Hosted by William Channer.

podcasts.name: 99U
podcasts.description: Once in a while, 99U sits down with a leading creative, thinker, or entrepreneur to delve deep into their one-of-a-kind insights about the creative process.

podcasts.name: Style Guide
podcasts.description: A small batch podcast hosted by Anna Debenham and Brad Frost, dedicated to talking about style guides, pattern libraries and building effective interface systems.

podcasts.name: One Design Podcast
podcasts.description: A fortnightly discussion about digital design with Kris Jeary, Bridget Tann and Andrew Fairlie

podcasts.name: Narwhals
podcasts.description: A podcast about design, development, business, family and fun. Join Drew Wilson and Keiran Flanigan as they share their experience on making a living building products.

podcasts.name: Hack to Start
podcasts.description: A podcast focused on interesting people and the innovative ways they achieve success.

podcasts.name: Inside Intercom
podcasts.description: Conversations with practitioners from the worlds of product management, design, startups and marketing.

podcasts.name: The Pitch
podcasts.description: The show where founders pitch their startups to investors. We find early stage startups, listen to their pitch and help them raise money from our audience of angel investors.

podcasts.name: Chasing Product
podcasts.description: The Chasing Product podcast helps consultants and freelancers transition from client work to releasing bootstrapped software products. If you want to get out of client work and in to product work, then you are Chasing Product.

podcasts.name: Bootstrapped Web
podcasts.description: Bootstrapped Web is for entrepreneurs bootstrapping their startups, who believe that the best way to get to where we're going is to learn by doing. Conversations, case studies, and interviews with entrepreneurs who are building profitable businesses online.

podcasts.name: The Startup Chat
podcasts.description: Unfiltered insights and actionable advice straight from the trenches of startup and business life. The show hosts, Steli Efti and Hiten Shah, are both serial entrepreneurs who have founded multi-million dollar SaaS startups. Being busy CEOs of fast-growing companies, they know the value of your time and make sure you get the most out of each 22 minute episode.

podcasts.name: Converge Podcast
podcasts.description: The Business of Creativity Podcast, hosted by Dane Sanders, explores the concentric circles of creating great things and finding innovative ways to profit from those creations.

podcasts.name: Giant Robots Smashing into other Giant Robots Podcast
podcasts.description: The Giant Robots Smashing into Other Giant Robots podcast is a weekly technical podcast discussing development, design, and the business of software development. Hosted by Ben Orenstein, who is joined each week by developers and designers from thoughtbot and beyond.

podcasts.name: Tentative
podcasts.description: Tentative is a podcast about digital product design, hosted by thoughtbot designers Reda Lemeden & Kyle Fiedler.

podcasts.name: The Bike Shed
podcasts.description: On The Bike Shed, hosts Derek Prior, Sean Griffin, Laila Winner, and guests discuss their development experience and challenges with Ruby, Rails, JavaScript, and whatever else is drawing their attention, admiration, or ire this week.

podcasts.name: Build Phase
podcasts.description: Build Phase is a weekly technical podcast discussing iOS development and design. Hosted by iOS developers Mark Adams and Gordon Fontenot; they discuss code, design, and creating great iOS apps

podcasts.name: The Distance
podcasts.description: The Distance features stories of private businesses that have been operating for at least 25 years and the people who got them there. Hear business owners share their stories of hard work, survival and building something that lasts. The Distance is a production of Basecamp, the company behind the leading project management app.

podcasts.name: The Laravel Podcast
podcasts.description: The Laravel Podcast brings you Laravel and PHP development news and discussion. The podcast is hosted by Matt Stauffer and regular guests include Taylor Otwell (the creator of Laravel) and Jeffrey Way (the creator of Laracasts).

podcasts.name: The Laracasts Snippet
podcasts.description: The Laracasts snippet, each episode, offers a single thought on some aspect of web development. Nothing more, nothing less. Hosted by Jeffrey Way.

podcasts.name: Node Up
podcasts.description: NodeUp is a podcast about Node.js

podcasts.name: Descriptive
podcasts.description: Descriptive is a weekly technical interview podcast with people from the JavaScript and web development world

podcasts.name: React Podcast
podcasts.description: The only podcast covering the latest in the reactjs ecosystem

podcasts.name: The Changelog
podcasts.description: Open source moves fast. The Changelog covers what's fresh and new

podcasts.name: Web of Tomorrow
podcasts.description: A podcast about JavaScript, web development, web design, and technology.

podcasts.name: New Rustacean
podcasts.description: Documenting a journey into a new programming language—with source code, examples, and almost certainly some out-and-out hilarities along the way.

podcasts.name: Ruby5
podcasts.description: The latest news in the Ruby and Rails community. This podcast is produced and distributed by Code School.

podcasts.name: The Ruby Rogues
podcasts.description: A weekly discussion by Ruby developers about programming, life, and careers.

podcasts.name: The Freelancers' Show
podcasts.description: Weekly discussion by freelancers and professionals about running a business, finding clients, marketing, and lifestyle related to being a freelancer.

podcasts.name: Adventures in Angular
podcasts.description: A weekly show dedicated to the AngularJS framework

podcasts.name: React Native Radio
podcasts.description: A weekly show dedicated to building apps with React Native

podcasts.name: Podcast.__init__
podcasts.description: This is a long form podcast about Python and the people who make it great. We conduct interviews about projects and topics that are of particular interest to people in the Python community.

podcasts.name: PHP Townhall
podcasts.description: Town Hall a way for PHP developers to raise questions about current events (or upcoming things) in the PHP community, with different guests each week.

podcasts.name: PHP Roundtable
podcasts.description: The PHP Roundtable is a podcast of web developers discussing PHP, JavaScript, community, open source, and anything else PHP nerds care about.

podcasts.name: This is Product Management
podcasts.description: This is Product Management interviews brilliant minds across numerous disciplines that fuel modern product teams. From design to statistics, we've got you covered.

podcasts.name: Product People
podcasts.description: A podcast focused on great products and the people who make them

podcasts.name: Global Product Management Talk
podcasts.description: Forwarding the movement for product excellence. Discussions about the art, craft and profession for managing products that contribute value. All aspects of customer development, user experience, product innovation, design, development, marketing and scaling.

podcasts.name: Product Hunt Radio
podcasts.description: Product Hunt Radio (PHR) is for the product geeks. Each week Ryan Hoover and Erik Torenberg are joined by founders, investors, and product people in the startup community & beyond to chat about products, technology, and the people who make them.

podcasts.name: What's Tech?
podcasts.description: We live in the future, where drones skim the sky, corporations enter the space race, and smart watches track our every movement. But how? And why? What's Tech invites experts to explain the technology bit by bit, in clear, brief, enjoyable audio nuggets. These days, technology is everywhere. Let's make sense of what's around us.

podcasts.name: Build and Launch
podcasts.description: A weekly podcast focused on shipping small projects. Every week I'll take you on an adventure of launching a new project. You'll hear the launch stats, hurdles I had to overcome, and how you can learn from my mistakes.

podcasts.name: The Businessology Show
podcasts.description: A podcast about the business of design, and the design of business.

podcasts.name: The Accidental Creative
podcasts.description: The Accidental Creative podcast shares how to build practical, everyday practices that help you stay prolific, brilliant and healthy in life and work.

podcasts.name: After the Jump
podcasts.description: Through a series of interviews with designers, store owners and up-and-coming members of the creative community, Grace will delve deeper into the world of independent artists. From exploring the day-to-day lives of contemporary makers to discussing the challenges they face, After the Jump will take the conversation off the screen and into real life.

podcasts.name: Mac Power User
podcasts.description: Learn about getting the most from your Apple technology with focused topics and workflow guests. Creating Mac Power Users, one geek at a time since 2009.

podcasts.name: Greyscalegorilla Podcast
podcasts.description: Nick Campbell's Show about How to Be Creative and Get Paid

podcasts.name: Go Media
podcasts.description: Go Media's Bryan Garvin sits down with members of the Go Media team and community to discuss the business of design and how to improve the quality of your work and life.

podcasts.name: The Twenty Minute VC
podcasts.description: The Twenty Minute VC takes you inside the world of Venture Capital, Startup Funding and The Pitch. The Twenty Minute VC provides an instructional guide as to what it takes to get employed in the Venture Capital industry, with VCs giving specific advice on how to get noticed from the crowd and increasing your chances of employment.

podcasts.name: Re/code Decode
podcasts.description: One of tech's most prominent journalists, Kara Swisher is known for her insightful reporting and straight-shooting style. Listen in as she hosts hard-hitting interviews about the week in tech with influential business leaders and outspoken personalities from media, politics and more.

podcasts.name: Motion and Meaning
podcasts.description: Motion and Meaning is a podcast about motion design for digital designers brought to you by Val Head and Cennydd Bowles.

podcasts.name: Workmode
podcasts.description: A series of conversations with leading design, tech and cultural creators on how they work. Hosted by Alex Nemeroff, Co-Founder of Dynamo, a digital agency in Montreal, Canada.

podcasts.name: Working File
podcasts.description: A podcast about design practice and its relationship to the world.
